akn:subsection.akn:heading: Limitation on Authority To Decide a Place Not an Eligible Place.—

akn:content.akn:p: (b) The Secretary may not decide that a place described in subsection (a)(1) of this section is not an eligible place on any basis that is not specifically stated in this subchapter.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Exception for Locations in Alaska and Hawaii.—

akn:content.akn:p: (c) Subparagraphs (B), (C), and (D) of subsection (a)(1) shall not apply with respect to locations in the State of Alaska or the State of Hawaii.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Exceptions for Locations More Than 175 Driving Miles From the Nearest Large or Medium Hub Airport.—

akn:content.akn:p: (d) Subsection (a)(1)(B) shall not apply with respect to locations that are more than 175 driving miles from the nearest large or medium hub airport.
(f) For purposes of subsection (a)(1)(B), the term “enplanements” means the number of passengers enplaning, at an eligible place, on flights operated by the subsidized essential air service carrier.
